stream_context.summary: Kaze live-blocked out the "retro section"—the game’s final level that stitches every Mario 64 stage together—while juggling memory limits, UV fixes, gameplay skips, and community sensitivity. He previewed a commissioned side-hack (“Drug Mario”), discussed emulator quirks, legal contingencies with Nintendo, and outlined scheduling conflicts caused by family visits and his daughter’s baptism.

development_findings.summary: The final "retro section" will combine all 15 Mario 64 stages in one continuous course, inspired by OnlyUp 64, and will serve as the game’s climactic challenge.
development_findings.quote: It’s going to be every Mario 64 level at the same time. We’re going to be retroing out so much.

development_findings.summary: Memory is tight (≈ ¼ MB free). Kaze removes triangles, splits geometry, and relies on code that relocates segments behind the frame-buffer to stay within limits.
development_findings.quote: We have not much space left, maybe like a quarter of a megabyte.

development_findings.summary: Design intent: allow creative skips but keep the course beatable without wing-cap or extended moves; wing-cap merely makes sections easier.
development_findings.quote: I want this game to be beatable without Mario’s extended moveset.

development_findings.summary: Overworld will depict all of Yoshi’s Island split into multiple areas; a single area is impossible due to N64 limits.
development_findings.quote: The overworld will be all of Yoshi’s Island… of course there will be multiple sections. It can’t be all one area.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is systematically fixing Nintendo’s sloppy UV mapping and adding minimal vertex colors, aiming for a look that’s ‘slightly better than vanilla.’
development_findings.quote: I have to fix the UV mapping, I cannot tolerate what the original developers did here.

development_findings.summary: Community complaints about LGBT-coded flags in the ‘Chess’ level triggered a redesign into an anti-Bowser protest theme.
development_findings.quote: People were saying they feel like this is offensive… so everything is going to be replaced with Bowser flags and ‘all koopas are bastards’ stickers.

development_findings.summary: Tooling preference: Nemu and PJ64 1.6 run the hack best; Kaze claims Parallel Launcher’s dev intentionally breaks compatibility with his hacks.
development_findings.quote: Every time I make a hack he patches Parallel Launcher so it can’t run the hack anymore.

development_findings.summary: Compilation with –O2 and an expanded ROM are required to keep large objects like the submarine from lagging.
development_findings.quote: Remember to compile your ROM with O2 so I can actually run the submarine here without my game lagging.

development_findings.summary: If Nintendo issues a takedown, Kaze will strip all Mario IP, reskin it as an original dinosaur game, and release it on Steam.
development_findings.quote: If they take it down I’ll just replace Mario with my own character… sell it on Steam… it’s a win-win.

context_findings.summary: Kaze treats Nintendo legal risk pragmatically and even welcomes a takedown as free publicity.
context_findings.quote: I kind of almost want them to take it down because then I have an excuse to turn this into my own game and sell it.

context_findings.summary: Expresses frustration with Parallel Launcher developer and pride in Nemu/PJ64.
context_findings.quote: I think the dev of Parallel Launcher just hates me.

context_findings.summary: Personal schedule: parents visiting for 10 days; daughter’s baptism next Saturday; streaming unlikely during that window.
context_findings.quote: Next Saturday my daughter is getting baptized, so I can’t stream.

context_findings.summary: Kaze and Zeina relax by ‘hate-watching’ anime like Seven Deadly Sins.
context_findings.quote: Me and Zeina are currently watching the anime Seven Deadly Sins—we’re hate-watching it because it’s so goddamn awful.

biobak.summary: Created most of the levels for the commissioned ‘Drug Mario’ hack.
biobak.quote: Biobak made like most of the levels here; it’s a long time ago.

biobak.summary: Is offered the option to redesign or ‘split’ the volcano section to increase difficulty.
biobak.quote: Do you want to just make this whole section by yourself? I’m fine with that.

zeina.summary: Zeina joins stream briefly; Kaze references shared viewing habits and mentions their upcoming busy family schedule.

key_stories.title: The Flag Controversy
key_stories.summary: Rainbow-patterned flags in the ‘Chess’ level were perceived as anti-LGBT by some viewers. Kaze, surprised, decides to re-theme the map.
key_stories.challenge: Community backlash over potentially offensive imagery.
key_stories.process: On stream Kaze polls chat, acknowledges concerns, and brainstorms replacements (Bowser protest, ‘all koopas are bastards’ signage).
key_stories.outcome: Plans to censor rainbow flags and reposition the level as an anti-Bowser protest space.
key_stories.key_quote: If we all perceive it to be offensive, then that’s bad. We’ll replace it with Bowser flags and ‘all koopas are bastards’.

key_stories.title: Building the Retro Section
key_stories.summary: Kaze assembles one gigantic course that fuses every Mario 64 level, balancing memory, gameplay flow, and skip potential.
key_stories.challenge: Tight memory on N64 hardware and risk of trivializing gameplay with wing-cap.
key_stories.process: Removes geometry, splits platforms, tests jumps, adds blockers, and continuously checks RAM usage.
key_stories.outcome: Functional grey-box of the final level; memory within limits; design rules established (creative skips okay, but no full trivialization).
key_stories.key_quote: We only have the town left, then the slide, and then the thing… This is such a cool retro section.

key_stories.title: Legal Contingency Plan
key_stories.summary: Kaze outlines a fallback if Nintendo issues a DMCA: re-skin the project into an original IP and commercialize it.
key_stories.challenge: Likelihood of takedown given prior 70 video removals.
key_stories.process: Explains replacing Mario with a dinosaur, Bowser with a crocodile, removing Nintendo code.
key_stories.outcome: Sees takedown as either neutral or beneficial; positions it as ‘win-win’.
key_stories.key_quote: I can just rip out their code and assets and it’s entirely my own game. Nintendo is not the dictator of the world.
